abstract.p: Roundup of recent advertising account changes (S)

block.p: Coca-Cola, Atlanta, expanded its relationship with Wieden & Kennedy, Portland, Ore., by awarding the agency the United States creative assignment for Diet Coke, which had been handled by the New York office of Draft FCB, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies. Spending was estimated at $60 million. Wieden creates campaigns for Coca-Cola Classic and Powerade. Draft FCB continues to create Diet Coke ads in some overseas markets.

The International Olympic Committee narrowed to four finalists a review for a worldwide ''Olympic values'' campaign for 2007-8; spending was estimated at more than $100 million. The finalists are Leo Burnett and Saatchi & Saatchi, part of the Publicis Groupe; Havas; and the United Group, part of the WPP Group. Saatchi & Saatchi created similar campaigns that ran before the 2004 and 2006 Olympics.

Coca-Cola, Atlanta, expanded its relationship with Wieden & Kennedy, Portland, Ore., by awarding the agency the United States creative assignment for Diet Coke, which had been handled by the New York office of Draft FCB, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies. Spending was estimated at $60 million. Wieden creates campaigns for Coca-Cola Classic and Powerade. Draft FCB continues to create Diet Coke ads in some overseas markets.

The International Olympic Committee narrowed to four finalists a review for a worldwide ''Olympic values'' campaign for 2007-8; spending was estimated at more than $100 million. The finalists are Leo Burnett and Saatchi & Saatchi, part of the Publicis Groupe; Havas; and the United Group, part of the WPP Group. Saatchi & Saatchi created similar campaigns that ran before the 2004 and 2006 Olympics.

Nortel Networks, Toronto, consolidated its worldwide account and awarded it to the San Francisco office of the McCann Worldgroup, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies. Spending in the United States, for campaigns created by the Richards Group, Dallas, was estimated at $10 million; spending in other countries was not disclosed.

Eastman Kodak, Rochester, which is trying to become more of a digital marketer, reorganized how its media assignments are handled by naming Neo@Ogilvy, a digital specialist, as its lead worldwide strategic media agency. MindShare, which handles traditional media planning and buying, will support Neo@Ogilvy; both are part of the WPP Group. Carat Fusion, part of the Aegis Group, previously handled digital media for Kodak.
